sentences.sContent: To investigate, his team injected cocaine, capsaicin or both at once into the abdomens of several groups of about 30 mice.
sentences.sContent_eng: To investigate, his team injected cocaine, capsaicin or both at once into the abdomens of several groups of about 30 mice.
sentences.sCn: 他的团队将辣椒素或可卡因中的一种，或同时将两种注射进几组老鼠的腹部，每组约30只。

sentences.sContent: Then the researchers repeated the experiment, but this time they injected rats with a dose of cocaine or morphine on one side and with a neutral saline solution on the other.
sentences.sContent_eng: Then the researchers repeated the experiment, but this time they injected rats with a dose of cocaine or morphine on one side and with a neutral saline solution on the other.
sentences.sCn: 然后，研究人员重复这项实验，但是这次他们给一边的小白鼠注射小剂量的可卡因或吗啡，而另一边注射中性盐水。

sentences.sContent: ...when cocaine eventually fell from grace as a beverage ingredient...

phrases.pCn: 可卡因；快克古柯碱；霹雳可卡因

trans.tranOther: a drug, usually in the form of a white powder, that is taken illegally for pleasure or used in some medical situations to prevent pain
